subject: Science
title: How Your Eyes See
description: A quick, practical guide to How Your Eyes See.

hook.text: Your eyes don't see. Your brain does. Eyes just collect light.

buildup.text: Light enters through the pupil, is focused by the lens, and hits the retina.

discovery.text: The retina has 120 million rods for dim light and 6 million cones for color.

twist.text: The image on your retina is upside down. Your brain flips it right-side up automatically.

climax.text: You have a blind spot where the optic nerve exits the eye. Your brain fills it in.

punchline.text: You see the world upside down with a hole in your vision. Your brain fixes everything.

quiz.question: Why don't you notice your blind spot?
options: Your brain fills in the missing information
Your other eye covers for it
The blind spot is too small to matter
